description: a(n) = 1 + sum of the anti-divisors of n.
comments: See A066272 for definition of anti-divisor.
links: Jon Perry, The Anti-divisor: Even More Anti-Divisors [Cached copy]
example: Consider n = 18: 2n-1, 2n, 2n+1 are 35, 36, 37 with odd divisors > 1 {5,7,35}, {3,9}, {37} respectively and quotients {7, 5, 1}, {12, 4}, {1}; so the anti-divisors of 18 are 4, 5, 7, 12. Therefore a(18) = 1 + 28 = 29.
author: _Jon Perry_, Dec 28 2001
